channel.title: Blog
channel.description: Resources and news in the areas of world history, genocide and teaching.

item.title: Updates on Armenian Genocide Information
item.description:
The Armenian Genocide is the first topic that I am editing and refining with expert help. The Director of Education for the Genocide Education Project, Sara Cohan, has helped me to eliminate less useful sources and directed me towards better ones on each of these pages. I am grateful to her for generously sharing her expertise.

Armenian Genocide - I have altered the description slightly to be more clear.

Definitions of Armenian Genocide - I have replaced about half the wikipedia definitions with definitions from academic sources more focused on the Armenian Genocide.

Links Regarding the Armenian Genocide - I have eliminated more politically-bent sites and added some new ones.

Films Dealing with the Armenian Genocide - I moved the Armenian language films to the bottom and deleted politically-bent films.

Bibliography of the Armenian Genocide - I have added several new books recommended by the Genocide Education Project.

item.title: 1971 Atrocities in Bangladesh: Definitions of Key Terms
item.description:
Here are some terms to start learning about the massacres in Bangladesh. Please know that I am starting each definitions page with wikipedia, so that I can group relevant terms in one place, but I will return to it and exchange those definitions for better ones as I find them.
Definitions of Genocide in Bangladesh

item.title: Genocide in Darfur: Definitions of Key Terms
item.description:
The current genocide in Darfur requires some background knowledge to be able to follow many of the more rigorous articles about it. Please start learning here, and then find a group where you can take action.
Definitions of Genocide in Darfur

item.title: Indonesian Massacres of 1965-66: Definitions of Key Terms
item.description: The Indonesian Massacres were a brutal event in the Cold War. I have put key terms here: Definitions of the Indonesian Massacres.

item.title: Genocide of the Herero & Nama: Definitions of Key Terms
item.description: This genocide is often referred to as the first modern genocide, and is often linked to later atrocities by the Nazis through medical training and ideology. I have put a list of terms for reference here: Definitions of the Genocide of the Herero & Nama.

item.title: Enemies of the People: A New Film
item.description: The second is a new film online for a few weeks about Cambodia. It was suggested to me by Sara Cohan, Director of Education at the Genocide Education Project. http://www.pbs.org/pov/enemies/. I posted the description on my Cambodian Films page, added at the bottom.

item.title: Jehovah’s Witness Additions
item.description:
They deal with the experiences and study of Jehovah’s Witnesses during the Holocaust brought to my attention by another H-Net listserv participant, Sandra Milakovich of the Arnold Liebster Foundation. The site is http://www.alst.org. I am adding it to my links for Holocaust information. Here is what she wrote me:

“I'd like to recommend the addition of an educational resource for teachers and students on the Nazi persecution of Jehovah's Witnesses at http://www.alst.org. The site is available in English, Spanish, French, German and Italian. The Arnold-Liebster Foundation, established by Holocaust-era survivors Max Liebster and Simone Arnold Liebster in January 2002, announced this new resource to The Association of Holocaust Organizations in 2007. Many Holocaust Institutions have added alst.org to their links page, including United States Holocaust Memorial Museum, Holocaust Center of Northern California, Shoah Foundation, Facing History and Ourselves, CANDLES Holocaust Museum, The Holocaust Chronicle, Jewish Virtual Library, Holocaust Museum Houston, Florida Holocaust Museum, Illinois Holocaust Museum & Education Center, Virginia Holocaust Museum, and NorthWest Center for Holocaust Genocide & Ethnocide Education.”

Sandra also suggested a book and a film which I will add at a later date. I am putting the information she provided below for now:
“Facing the Lion - Memoirs of a Young Girl in Nazi Europe by Simone Arnold Liebster
Facing the Lion is the autobiographical account of a young girl's faith and courage. Set during the Nazi occupation of Eastern France, it tells the story of one 12-year-old's struggle to follow her conscience rather than give in to Nazi propaganda and persecution. Simone's honesty about her joys and fears and her harrowing experiences at school and in a Nazi prison have appealed to thousands of readers, many of whom are young people themselves, struggling with similar peer pressure today. 
Available in unabridged and abridged editions, English and Spanish
Appropriate for middle and high school students
Free downloadable Study Guides at http://www.alst.org/pages-us/education/study-guides.html
Free interactive Skype conference with author at http://www.alst.org/pages-us/education/interactive-videoconference.html

Jehovah's Witnesses Stand Firm Against Nazi Assault  28-minute Classroom Edition Documentary DVD with Study Guide available in English and Spanish
As the Nazi killing machine engulfed Europe with terror, thousands of Jehovah's Witnesses suffered brutal persecution. In this DVD, 10 historians from Europe and North America, and more than 20 Witness survivors, join in relating a story of courage and triumph that must be told.  56-page Study Guide includes lesson plan, activities, survivor profiles with discussion questions, selected readings, glossary, chronology and transcript.
Appropriate for middle and high school students
Available from United States Holocaust Memorial Museum Book Shop at www.ushmm.org and from Reed Presentations, Inc. (Contact Sandra at 800-774-1599 x 121)”

item.title: General Site Suggestions
item.description:
A general site of world history resources created by an H-Net listserv member, Tim Vermande. The site can be found at: http://www.vermande.us/tim/200.html. I am also posting it to my page for General World History Resources.

He also mentioned that my RSS feed does not work, so I am taking it off since I do not have the expertise to fix it (this whole site is being created off of iWeb).
